Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Preoperative Internal Carotid Artery Stenting in Lateral Skull Base Paraganglioma Surgery

Trial_Design.evidence: Randomisation and blinding were not applicable due to the retrospective design.

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria included histologically confirmed paraganglioma, extensive vascular involvement, and ICA stenting followed by surgery.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the efficacy of preoperative internal carotid artery (ICA) stenting in enhancing surgical outcomes for lateral skull base paragangliomas.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the extent of tumor resection, measured intraoperatively.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and blinding were not applicable due to the retrospective design.

Blinding.evidence: Randomisation and blinding were not applicable due to the retrospective design.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Randomisation and blinding were not applicable due to the retrospective design.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Gross total tumor resection was achieved in 85% of patients.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Gross total tumor resection was achieved in 85% of patients.

Harms.evidence: Adverse events included one case of thalamus infarction, which resolved without permanent sequelae.
